ygData.subject: Re: Enchanters and Research (Bersker Str)
ygData.msgSnippet: I have been a muder for 5+ years.  The greatest mud I ever played on was Sojourn.  It is remarkably similar to this place in many ways.  It is also different
ygData.messageBody:
I have been a muder for 5+ years. The greatest mud I ever played on was
Sojourn. It is remarkably similar to this place in many ways. It is also
different in many ways. I have seen people (Troll Warr to be specific) jet
to 40+ level in under 2 months.. while meanwhile myself and experienced
player was on for over 20 years and only made 36th. There are a lot of
factors in leveling and I almost guarantee he was a beta tester.

Siz

-----Original Message-----
From: Tony Williams <vincedis@...>
To: EQ_spell_research@onelist.com <EQ_spell_research@onelist.com>
Date: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 3:57 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ_spell_research] Enchanters and Research (Bersker Str)


>From: Tony Williams <vincedis@...>
>
>I'm with Trev on this one. My favorite MUD back in 93-95 was Isenguard.
This particular mud was very VERY hard to advance in levels. The highest
characters that had been playing for a while were 16th and 17th level. if
you got to level 10 you were a really good player. level 7 was a reasonable
achievement for 6 months of play. Why do you want to have a lv 50 char?
There shouldn't be any level 40 chars for at least 2 years. The fact that I
saw a lv 42 character on Ebay for sale I think is rediculous. the fact that
someone is willing to pay thousands of dollars for such a char is even more
so. Are you one of the ones that used the trainers and hacked items in
Diablo? I don't want this game to be a flash in the pan. It should be very
hard to reach the higher levels and even harder to keep them(ie you die you
lose 3 or 4 levels) Just because you pay to play doesn't mean you should
automatically win. please try to keep in mind that some people like a
chalange and some are willing to
>face it no matter how difficult. I've only been playing a very short time
and if I had already seen all there was to see then I would think I'd move
on to another game. If you continue to pester Verant with things like this
they will eventually break down and everyone will have flowing black robes
and skull fanged stiletto's. I wish there were more people out there like
Trev willing to stand up for the AI and say hey this is too easy give me my
moneys worth. If fun for you is simply more power then the true meaning of
Role Playing has eluded you. may the gameing gods have mercy on your soul.
>
>Vincedis
>
>PS Yes the wiz spell flight is simply a levetate scroll. the one that is
made through research can only be scribed by wizards where as the one you
buy can be scribed by a few classes. other than that it is the same. (and
thus I have remained on topic sorry for the rant ;-)
>
>
>> Trev wrote:
>> >
>> > I'm amazed you could get spells through on a Griffon or HG at that
level....
>
>
>
>> By saying something as innane and anal as that, you stifle team work and
the desire and adventure to try something more. To be dareing & adventurious
is that not what it's all about? People like you who condone such changes
that FURTHER hamper the fun, ease, and playabilty for gamers should be
forced to play Smurf warriors in Splitpaw or something. See, what retarted
petty people like you forget is WE PAY VERANT'S BILLS. and thus the game
should be free of the kind of asinine restrictions that you would have
further placed upon the game. ..... We need not further restrictions but,
benefits to make it more fun,
>>
>> The Widows Son,
>> Vastad
>> Enchanter Cazic -Thule
>
>
